title: Intercept 001
text:
Agent, we intercepted a communication, but it looks like a shopping list. What is the target looking for? 

- Lima beans
- India pale ale
- Golf clubs
- Hotel bookings
- Tango lessons
hint: Look closely at the first letter of each item.

title: Sequence Alpha
text:
Complete the agent rotation sequence:

M, V, E, M, J, S, U, _
hint: Look up at the night sky. Think astronomically.

title: The Fibonacci Drop
text:
The lock to the safe room requires the next number in this sequence to open:

1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, _
hint: Add the two previous numbers together.

title: Keyboard Cipher
text:
A mole left this note at the drop site. The key is to look at your keyboard, but shift your perspective exactly one key to the left.

O E T O D E
hint: What letter is directly to the left of 'O' on a QWERTY keyboard?

title: Numerical Sequence Beta
text:
Identify the next character in this sequence to bypass the firewall:

O, T, T, F, F, S, S, E, _
hint: Count out loud starting from the number one.

title: Riddle 01
text: I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
hint: You might hear this if you yell into a canyon.

title: Binary Progression
text:
The server logs show this pattern. What is the next number?

0, 1, 10, 11, 100, _
hint: This is how computers count (Binary). What comes after 4?

title: The Cartographer's Secret
text: I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
hint: You use this to navigate.

title: Weight Shift
text: Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?
hint: Read the answer backward. 'Not' backward is 'ton'.

title: The Final Lock
text: What has keys but can't open locks?
hint: It is a musical instrument.

title: Caesar's Ghost
text:
An old operative is using a basic shift cipher. If 'A' becomes 'B', and 'B' becomes 'C', decrypt this target:

T Q Z
hint: Shift every letter backwards by exactly one position.

title: Temporal Sequence
text:
The timestamps on the leaked documents follow a strict pattern. What is the missing character?

J, F, M, A, M, J, J, A, S, O, N, _
hint: Think about the calendar year.

title: The Courier's Package
text: The courier is carrying an item that begins with an E, ends with an E, but only contains one single letter. What is it?
hint: It has a stamp on it.

title: Numeric Cipher
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission into a five-letter word:

1, 12, 16, 8, 1

title: The Paradox Intercept
text: I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
hint: Comedians tell these.

title: Dictionary Anomaly
text: Identify the target word: It is an 11-letter English word that is always spelled incorrectly in every single dictionary.
hint: Read the puzzle description very, very literally.

title: The Sub-Deck Drop
text: Type the exact six-letter string formed by looking at the top letter row of your keyboard, and moving straight down one row.
hint: Look directly beneath Q W E R T Y.

title: Phonetic Color
text:
Identify the getaway vehicle's color based on this radio chatter:

Whiskey, Hotel, India, Tango, Echo
hint: It's the NATO phonetic alphabet again.

title: Retrograde Analysis
text:
The agent's location was transmitted backwards to evade scanners. Where is the drop?

N I L R E B
hint: It's a major city in Germany.

title: The Vault Combination
text:
The safe requires a 4-digit code. 
The first digit is exactly half the second. 
The third is the sum of the first two. 
The fourth is the second digit minus the first.

If the first digit is 2, what is the code?
hint: If the 1st is 2, the 2nd must be 4. Now do the math for the rest.

title: Prime Directive
text:
The firewall port sequence follows a fundamental mathematical rule:

2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, _
hint: These numbers can only be divided by 1 and themselves.

title: The Ghost Agent
text: I come once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years. Who am I?
hint: Look at the words themselves, not the concept of time.

title: Roman Intercept
text:
The ancient sleeper cell is awakening. What is the next passcode in their sequence?

V I I I, I X, X, X I, _
hint: Count up in Roman numerals. 8, 9, 10, 11...

title: Border Dispute
text: A covert transport plane crashes exactly on the border of France and Germany. Where do international laws require them to bury the survivors?
hint: Read the briefing very carefully. Pay attention to the state of the passengers.

title: The Letter Drop
text: What occurs once in every year, twice in every month, but never in a day?
hint: Look at the spelling of the timeframes.

title: Elemental Breach
text:
The bio-lab lock uses the building blocks of the universe. What is the next letter?

H, He, Li, Be, B, C, N, O, _
hint: Think back to chemistry class. The Periodic Table.

title: Audio Surveillance
text: We tapped the room. The target said: 'I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even.' What number is the target?
hint: Write out the names of odd numbers and remove the first letter.

title: The Silent Room
text: The more there is of this in the interrogation room, the less you can see. What is it?
hint: Turn off the lights.

title: Shift Cipher Delta
text:
Decode the following using a simple substitution where A=26, B=25, C=24, etc.

S V O O L
hint: It's the alphabet written backward.

title: Grid Protocol
text: If a red house is made of red bricks, and a blue house is made of blue bricks, what is a greenhouse made of?
hint: Think about what a greenhouse actually is.

title: Sequential Logic
text:
Enter the missing character from this repeating cycle:

S, M, T, W, T, F, _
hint: Look at a calendar.

title: The Waterway
text: What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
hint: It flows into the ocean.

title: Vowel Protocol
text:
What is the next letter in this highly classified linguistic sequence?

A, E, I, O, _
hint: The building blocks of English pronunciation.

title: Zero Sum
text: I am a three-digit number. My second digit is four times bigger than the third digit. My first digit is three less than my second digit. What number am I?
hint: Start with the third digit. If it's 1, the second is 4, and the first is 1. Does 141 work?

title: Directional Tap
text:
The target's movements follow a strict compass pattern. Where are they heading next?

N, E, S, _
hint: Never Eat Shredded Wheat.

title: The Sibling Code
text: Agent Smith has four daughters, and each of his daughters has a brother. How many children does Agent Smith have in total?
hint: All the daughters share the same brother.

title: Digital Root
text: Multiply all the numbers on a standard telephone keypad together. What is the total?
hint: Look very closely at all the numbers on a keypad, particularly the bottom row.

title: Mirror Intercept
text: What looks like half an apple?
hint: Symmetry.

title: The Hollow Cylinder
text: What has an eye but cannot see?
hint: It is used to sew clothes.

title: The Endless Knot
text: What has a head and a tail but no body?
hint: You can flip this in the air.

title: Cold Storage
text: You walk into a dark cabin with only one match. There is an oil lamp, a fireplace, and a candle. To survive, what do you light first?
hint: Chronology is key. You can't light anything without the source.

title: Visual Cipher
text: I have branches, but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
hint: People put their money here.

title: The Traitor's Name
text: The traitor belongs to you, but your friends use it more than you do. What is it?
hint: It's what people call you.

title: Color Coordination
text: What is black when it's clean and white when it's dirty?
hint: Used in old classrooms.

title: Weightless Cargo
text: An operative places this in a barrel, making the barrel lighter. What did they put in?
hint: It's an absence of material.

title: The Ascending Drop
text: What goes up but never comes down?
hint: It increases every year on your birthday.

title: Fractured Glass
text: If you drop me I'm sure to crack, but give me a smile and I'll always smile back. What am I?
hint: You check your reflection in this.

title: The Step Cipher
text:
Complete the alphabetical jump sequence:

A, C, E, G, I, _
hint: Skip every other letter.

title: Liquid Asset
text: I can be full, but I never overflow. I can be empty, but I never leak. What am I?
hint: It's in the night sky.

title: The Final Echo
text: What word is spelled incorrectly in every single dictionary?
hint: Look at the word itself.

title: Operation Square
text:
Bypass the numeric lock sequence:

1, 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, _
hint: Multiply numbers by themselves.

title: The Empty Drop
text: I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter but not go outside. What am I?
hint: You are probably looking at one right now.

title: Target Profile
text: The target was born in 1980. He is alive and well today, but he just celebrated his 11th birthday. How?
hint: February 29th.

title: Safe House Design
text: The safe house is a one-story bungalow. Everything is painted grey. Grey walls, grey doors, grey furniture. What color are the stairs?
hint: Read the first sentence of the briefing again.

title: Asset Pursuit
text: You are in a foot chase. You overtake the operative in second place. What position are you in now?
hint: You took their spot, not the leader's spot.

title: Thermal Scan
text: Which crate is heavier for the transport chopper: a ton of gold bars or a ton of feathers?
hint: Look at the weights, not the materials.

title: Decryption Key 7
text: If you drop a classified dossier in the Red Sea, what does it become?
hint: Physics applies to everything.

title: Night Optics
text: What has many teeth but cannot bite?
hint: It is used for grooming.

title: The Interrogation
text: I am tall when I'm young, and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
hint: I provide light and melt.

title: Secure Perimeter
text: What has to be broken before you can use it?
hint: A classic breakfast food.

title: The Alibi
text: A target pushes his car to a hotel and tells the owner he's bankrupt. Why?
hint: It's a very famous board game.

title: Missing Intel
text: What is full of holes but still holds water?
hint: It's used for cleaning dishes.

title: Classified Document
text: I shave every single day, but my beard stays exactly the same. What am I?
hint: It is my profession.

title: The Blackout
text: What gets wetter the more it dries?
hint: You use it after a shower.

title: Evacuation Route
text: Some months have 31 days. How many have 28?
hint: Every single one of them.

title: The Shadow
text: Only one color, but not one size. Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies. Present in sun, but not in rain.
hint: Look behind you on a sunny day.

title: The Asset's Secret
text: Feed me and I live, yet give me a drink and I die. What am I?
hint: Requires oxygen and fuel to survive.

title: Intercept 008
text: What can you catch from a suspect but not throw?
hint: Ah-choo.

title: Cipher Delta
text:
Complete the alphabetic jump sequence:

A, B, D, G, K, _
hint: The gap increases by 1 each time.

title: The Courier
text: I have four legs but cannot walk.
hint: You eat dinner on it.

title: Vowel Check
text: What single word contains all twenty-six letters?
hint: Read the question very literally.

title: Numeric Drop
text: If an operative, his sister, and their dog weren't under an umbrella, why didn't they get wet?
hint: Check the weather report.

title: Audio Bug
text: What goes up and down but doesn't move?
hint: It connects two floors of a building.

title: The Dead Drop
text: I have a neck but no head, and I wear a cap. What am I?
hint: Used to hold liquids.

title: Location Ping
text: What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
hint: You make this when you swear to do something.

title: Covert Comm
text: What word is pronounced exactly the same if you take away four of its five letters?
hint: A line of people waiting.

title: Safe Lock
text: The more you take, the more you leave behind.
hint: Walking in the snow.

title: Intel Drop
text: What has hands but cannot clap?
hint: It tells you when the deadline is.

title: Sector Sweep
text: What has a thumb and four fingers, but is not alive?
hint: It keeps your hand warm in winter.

title: The Double Agent
text: If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven't got me. What am I?
hint: A classified piece of intel.

title: Briefcase Lock
text: What has words, but never speaks?
hint: You read it.

title: Observation Post
text: What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
hint: It marks the property line.

title: The Sleeper
text: What building has the most stories?
hint: It contains thousands of books.

title: Secure Line
text: What is always in front of you but can't be seen?
hint: Tomorrow.

title: Contraband
text: What can you hold in your right hand, but never in your left hand?
hint: Look at your own arms.

title: Night Watch
text: What gets sharper the more you use it?
hint: The organ inside your skull.

title: The Global Asset
text: What travels around the world but stays in one spot?
hint: Placed on an envelope.

title: Undercover
text: I have no life, but I can die. What am I?
hint: Powers your electronics.

title: The Intercepted Package
text: What is easy to get into, but hard to get out of?
hint: When you get caught breaking the rules.

title: Time Dilation
text: There is a word that becomes shorter when you add two letters to it. What is the word?
hint: Look at the word 'short'.

title: Cryptic Exchange
text: What disappears as soon as you say its name?
hint: Quiet.

title: The Traitor's Riddle
text: The person who makes it doesn't need it. The person who buys it doesn't use it. The person who uses it can't see it.
hint: Buried six feet under.

title: Grid Square
text: What has a bottom at the top?
hint: Attached to your foot.

title: Operation Alpha
text: My first two letters signify a male, my first three signify a female, my first four signify a great man, my entire word signifies a great woman.
hint: He, Her, Hero...

title: Pattern Recognition
text: Which letter of the alphabet holds the most water?
hint: Say the letters out loud.

title: Echo Protocol
text: What starts with a P, ends with an E, and has thousands of letters?
hint: Where mail gets sorted.

title: Asset Transport
text: I have four legs but no feet. I have a beautiful back but no spine.
hint: You sit on it.

title: The Mole
text: What starts with a T, ends with a T, and has T in it?
hint: A vessel for a hot British drink.

title: Radio Frequency
text: I am a word of letters three, add two and fewer there will be. What am I?
hint: Look at the word 'few'.

title: The Final Vault
text: You see a boat filled with people. It has not sunk, but when you look again you don't see a single person on the boat. Why?
hint: They all had spouses.

title: Exponential Drop
text:
Decrypt the numerical sequence left at the drop site:

2, 4, 8, 16, 32, _
hint: Double the previous number.

title: The Cubic Lock
text:
The safe dial follows a strict cubic pattern. What is the next passcode?

1, 8, 27, 64, 125, _

title: Grid Protocol 96
text:
Calculate the missing transmission frequency:

3, 6, 12, 24, 48, _
hint: Multiply by two.

title: Descending Steps
text:
The firewall ports are closing in a cascading sequence:

100, 99, 96, 91, 84, 75, _
hint: Subtract 1, then subtract 3, then subtract 5...

title: Ascension Protocol
text:
To open the blast doors, enter the next number in the chain:

2, 3, 5, 8, 12, 17, _
hint: Add 1, then add 2, then add 3...

title: Echo Progression
text:
The radar ping is bouncing back at expanding intervals:

5, 10, 20, 40, 80, _
hint: Double the value.

title: Twin Digits
text:
A covert beacon is broadcasting this repetitive sequence:

11, 22, 33, 44, 55, _
hint: Add 11.

title: Magnification Code
text:
The target's bank account transfers are growing by a factor of ten:

10, 100, 1000, 10000, _
hint: Add another zero.

title: Factorial Breach
text:
Bypass the mainframe using this escalating multiplication sequence:

1, 2, 6, 24, 120, _
hint: Multiply by 2, then by 3, then by 4, then by 5...

title: Countdown Timer
text:
The explosive timer is counting down irregularly:

21, 20, 18, 15, 11, _
hint: Subtract 1, then 2, then 3, then 4...

title: Alias Anagram 01
text:
Agent, unscramble the target's alias to reveal their location:

D O R M I T O R Y
hint: It's an anagram for a messy place to sleep.

title: Alias Anagram 02
text:
Unscramble this directive to find out what the operative was instructed to be:

L I S T E N
hint: An anagram meaning 'making no noise'.

title: Alias Anagram 03
text: The suspect claims to be an ASTRONOMER. What is their true identity?
hint: An anagram for someone who looks at the night sky.

title: Alias Anagram 04
text: The surveillance team reported: THE EYES. What are they doing?
hint: An anagram describing vision.

title: Alias Anagram 05
text: The asset disguised himself as A GENTLEMAN. Unscramble to reveal his style.
hint: An anagram meaning 'well-dressed'.

title: Alias Anagram 06
text: The meeting place is a FUNERAL. Unscramble the word to find the irony.
hint: An anagram meaning 'a very good time'.

title: Alias Anagram 07
text: The transmission arrived in THE MORSE CODE. What did the receiver say?
hint: An anagram pointing out the incoming transmission.

title: Alias Anagram 08
text: The equation left on the blackboard was ELEVEN PLUS TWO. Unscramble it to find the other equation.
hint: It equals 13.

title: Alias Anagram 09
text: The target was last seen near the SLOT MACHINES. Unscramble to find out what happened to his funds.
hint: An anagram meaning 'my money is gone'.

title: Alias Anagram 10
text: The guard ignored the SNOOZE ALARMS. Unscramble to find out what happened to his sleep.
hint: An anagram meaning 'no more resting'.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 01
text:
Decrypt the numeric sequence into a five-letter word using A=1, B=2, C=3...

2, 18, 1, 22, 15
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with B.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 02
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

4, 5, 12, 20, 1
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with D.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 03
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

5, 3, 8, 15
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with E.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 04
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

18, 15, 13, 5, 15
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with R.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 05
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

10, 21, 12, 9, 5, 20
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with J.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 06
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

22, 9, 3, 20, 15, 18
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with V.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 07
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

20, 1, 14, 7, 15
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with T.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 08
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

19, 9, 5, 18, 18, 1
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with S.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 09
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

14, 15, 22, 5, 13, 2, 5, 18
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with N.

title: Alpha-Numeric Code 10
text:
Translate the following numerical transmission:

15, 19, 3, 1, 18
hint: A phonetic alphabet word starting with O.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 01
text:
The operative encrypted their message by typing exactly one key to the RIGHT on a standard QWERTY keyboard. Decrypt this:

W E R
hint: Look to the right of W, E, and R.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 02
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

A S D
hint: Look to the right of A, S, and D.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 03
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

Z X C
hint: Look to the right of Z, X, and C.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 04
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

Q A Z
hint: Look at the far left column of your keyboard and shift right.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 05
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

Y U I
hint: Look to the right of Y, U, and I.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 06
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

H J K
hint: Look to the right of H, J, and K.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 07
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

V B N
hint: Look to the right of V, B, and N.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 08
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

E D C
hint: Look to the right of E, D, and C.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 09
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

T G B
hint: Look to the right of T, G, and B.

title: QWERTY Shift Right 10
text:
Decrypt the following string by shifting one key to the RIGHT:

O I U
hint: Look to the right of O, I, and U.

title: Compound Link 01
text:
Agent, find the single word that can be added to the end of all three of these words to create new compound words:

Sun, Eye, Shot
hint: It breaks easily.

title: Compound Link 02
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Foot, Base, Snow
hint: Used in sports.

title: Compound Link 03
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Water, Fall, Bow
hint: Precipitation.

title: Compound Link 04
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Light, Green, Bird
hint: A place where people live.

title: Compound Link 05
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Pan, Cup, Fish
hint: A baked dessert.

title: Compound Link 06
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Black, White, Key
hint: A flat surface or piece of wood.

title: Compound Link 07
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Fire, Water, Wood
hint: A target or a stain.

title: Compound Link 08
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Sea, Egg, Nut
hint: A hard exterior casing.

title: Compound Link 09
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Star, Jelly, Gold
hint: An aquatic animal.

title: Compound Link 10
text:
Find the single word that can be added to the end of all three words:

Tooth, Hair, Paint
hint: Used with bristles.

title: Color Vector
text:
Complete the primary color sequence to unlock the terminal:

R, Y, _
hint: Red, Yellow...

title: Global Coordinates
text:
The target is visiting continents alphabetically. Where are they heading next?

A, A, A, A, E, N, _
hint: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America...

title: Spectrum Analysis
text:
The laser grid cycles through the visible light spectrum. What is the final color?

R, O, Y, G, B, I, _
hint: Richard Of York Gave Battle In...

title: Astrological Cipher
text:
The cult uses the Zodiac to encode their meeting dates. What comes last?

A, T, G, C, L, V, L, S, S, C, A, _
hint: Aries, Taurus, Gemini... the last one represents fish.

title: The Grandmaster
text:
The Russian defector left this sequence of chess pieces. What is the final missing piece?

K, Q, R, B, K, _
hint: King, Queen, Rook, Bishop, Knight...

title: Naval Routes
text:
The submarine is traversing the five oceans alphabetically. Where does it end?

A, A, I, P, _
hint: Arctic, Atlantic, Indian, Pacific...

title: Currency Trace
text:
The bribe was paid in US coins, ordered by value. What comes next?

P, N, D, Q, H, _
hint: Penny, Nickel, Dime, Quarter, Half-Dollar...

title: Numerical Logic
text:
Complete the sequence by identifying the underlying rule:

Z, O, T, T, F, F, S, S, E, _
hint: Zero, One, Two, Three...

title: Symmetrical Encryption
text:
The firewall only accepts letters with perfect vertical symmetry. Enter the next valid letter:

A, H, I, M, O, T, U, V, W, X, _
hint: If you draw a line down the middle, both sides look identical.

title: Acoustic Sequence
text:
The lock responds to musical notes in a standard C major scale. What completes the octave?

C, D, E, F, G, A, _
hint: The note right before it repeats back to C.

title: Atmospheric Anomaly
text: I fly without wings. I cry without eyes. What am I?
hint: You see them in the sky.

title: The Infinite Horizon
text: What is always coming but never arrives?
hint: The day after today.

title: The Barometer
text: What goes up and down but doesn't move?
hint: It measures how hot or cold a room is.

title: Supernatural Safehouse
text: What room do ghosts avoid?
hint: A room where people are alive.

title: Audio Intercept
text: What instrument can you hear but never see?
hint: Everyone has one when they speak.

title: Numeric Riddle
text: If two's company, and three's a crowd, what are four and five?
hint: Do the math. Add them together.

title: Geometrical Puzzle
text: You draw a line on a piece of paper. Without touching the line, how do you make it shorter?
hint: Change its relative size.

title: Weight Discrepancy
text: I am easy to lift, but hard to throw. What am I?
hint: It comes from a bird.

title: Sensory Deprivation
text: What tastes better than it smells?
hint: It's the organ in your mouth.

title: Chronological Paradox
text: Where does today come before yesterday?
hint: A book full of alphabetized words.

title: Reverse Alphabet
text:
The enemy is using a retrograde alphabetic sequence. What comes next?

Z, Y, X, W, V, _
hint: The alphabet backwards.

title: Shift Cipher Two
text:
The cipher shifts every letter exactly two spaces forward (A becomes C). Decrypt this target:

A B C
hint: Shift A, B, and C forward by 2 in the alphabet.

title: Retrograde Shift
text:
The cipher shifts every letter exactly one space backwards (B becomes A). Decrypt this target:

B C D
hint: Shift B, C, and D backwards by 1 in the alphabet.

title: Atbash Cipher
text:
The Atbash cipher folds the alphabet in half, so A=Z, B=Y, C=X. Decrypt this target:

A B C
hint: The first three letters from the end of the alphabet.

title: Vowel Isolation
text:
The passcode only uses the vowels of the English alphabet in order. What is the third character?

A, E, _, O, U
hint: The letter between E and O.

title: Phonetic Alphabet 01
text:
Complete the NATO Phonetic Alphabet sequence:

Charlie, Delta, _
hint: A word starting with E.

title: Phonetic Alphabet 02
text:
Complete the NATO Phonetic Alphabet sequence:

Papa, Quebec, _
hint: A word starting with R.

title: Binary Code
text: The server logs display binary counting. 1 is 1. 2 is 10. 3 is 11. What is 4?
hint: The next binary number after 11.

title: Hexadecimal Key
text: The hexadecimal system uses letters for numbers above 9. 10 is A. 11 is B. What is 15?
hint: Count up the alphabet to the 6th letter.

title: Roman Numerals
text: Complete the Roman Numeral translation. 50 is L. 100 is C. What is 500?
hint: The Roman Numeral for 500.

title: Economic Sabotage
text: A bat and a ball cost $1.10 in total. The bat costs exactly $1.00 more than the ball. How many cents does the ball cost?
hint: It is not 10 cents. If the ball was 10, the bat would be 1.10, making the total 1.20.

title: Industrial Output
text: If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how many minutes does it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
hint: Each machine takes 5 minutes to make its own widget.

title: Biological Growth
text: In a lake, a patch of lily pads doubles in size every day. It takes 48 days to cover the lake. How many days did it take to cover half the lake?
hint: Work backwards. If it doubles every day, what was it the day before the 48th day?

title: The Farm Asset
text: A farmer has 17 sheep, and all but 9 die. How many are left?
hint: Read the phrasing very carefully.

title: Numerical Subtraction
text: How many times can you subtract 10 from 100?
hint: After the first time, you are no longer subtracting from 100.

title: Mathematical Trap
text: Divide 30 by half and add 10. What is the final number?
hint: Dividing by a half (0.5) is the same as multiplying by 2.

title: The Butcher's Weight
text: A clerk at a butcher shop is five feet ten inches tall. What does he weigh?
hint: Look at his profession, not his height.

title: Geographical History
text: Before Mt. Everest was discovered, what was the highest mountain in the world?
hint: Discovery doesn't change physical reality.

title: Excavation Site
text: How much dirt is in a hole that is 3 feet deep and 3 feet wide?
hint: Think about the definition of a hole.

title: Temporal Anomaly
text: What appears once in a day, twice in a week, but never in a month?
hint: Look at the letters in the words.

title: Headquarters Check
text: Agent, confirm your knowledge. MI6 headquarters is located on the bank of which river?
hint: The famous river running through London.

title: Enemy Agencies
text: The KGB was the main security agency for which former global power?
hint: The Union of Soviet Socialist Republics.

title: Allied Agencies
text: Langley, Virginia is home to the headquarters of which allied intelligence agency?
hint: Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Fictional Operatives
text: What famous fictional British spy's numeric designation is 007?
hint: Shaken, not stirred.

title: Operational Terminology
text: In espionage, an agent who penetrates a rival organization is named after a small, tunneling animal. What is it?
hint: It lives underground and is blind.

title: Cryptographic Terms
text: A method that substitutes letters with other letters is called a substitution _____
hint: Another word for a secret code.

title: Covert Chemistry
text: A classic, low-tech invisible ink can be made from a liquid commonly found in citrus fruits. What is it?
hint: Squeezed from a yellow fruit.

title: Historical Ciphers
text: The 'Enigma' was a famous cipher machine used primarily by which country during WWII?
hint: Alan Turing cracked their codes.

title: Cyber Security
text: The process of making coded messages unreadable to unauthorized users is called...
hint: Starts with an E.

title: The Name of the Game
text: Agent, finally, what does the 'HQ' in GCHQ stand for?
hint: The central location of an organization.
